intro: Glochidion ornatum, commonly known as the ornate glabrous vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody vines and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Glochidion ornatum is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
